column4: How can I stop SSH starting on startup? I ran sudo update-rc.d -f ssh remove, ... no error messages but SSH still starts up on the next bootup.
How can I stop SSH starting on startup? I ran sudo update-rc.d -f ssh remove, ... no error messages but SSH still starts up on the next bootup.
the virtualbox from their site runs faster than the ubuntu version
no need to have a separate home partition really
if your install goes wrong then you can boot a livecd, backup and reinstall
what're you trying to do? I missed it?
>> How can I stop SSH starting on startup? I ran sudo update-rc.d -f ssh remove, ... no error messages but SSH still starts up on the next bootup.
the bootloader (grub) is to be installed into the MBR, so /dev/sda in Kingsys case. wth should it be written to sdb?
it makes no sense at all. why should one change the BIOS just for booting, when writing grub into sda works fine?
we're talking about Kingsy  who wants to install? so what is "already installed"?
he said he's already installed 5 times
so nothing is installed right now. stop talking nonsense please
he hasn't wiped his hard drive
